title: Dungeons & Dragons

reviews.content: we should get rid of critic reviews

I've never been a big D&D fan to be honest, but when I went to go see this movie, I started to question if I wasted my Sunday's just playing a basic, no good bored game. The move a a nice amount of action, great characters and an amazing story line. The villain was actually pretty terrifying and was part of the reason I cared about the quest. Great movie 
a solid 5 in a half stars :)

Enjoyable, fun, captivating story and movie.  The right actors were selected for this movie.  They did a terrific job.  The entire movie is a spectacle of entertainment.  The fat dragon is hilarious.  Even my wife who doesn't like sci-fi and fantasy movies said this one was good,... probably because Chris Pine is in it.
I absolutely loved this movie. It beats the d&d movies from the past hands down.
Loved it!!! Movie was funny, combat were awesome! Good emotional core and story! Great acting! Wow!!!!
Fun movie! Action, adventure, some accurate D&D references, humor and it hits you a little in the feels. Worth the watch, hope they make more!
Excellent casting, great storyline, funny and entertaining!!

Just a really fun time. Great characters and good writing paired with a smaller scaled adventure that matches well to make a pretty fun adaptation that wouldn't be far from a campaign you might have seen in a DnD campaign. Great stuff
I know nothing of the game, but I like the lead actors, and BOY WAS THAT SO MUCH FUN!!! It often felt like a fantasy Star Trek in the best way possible
enjoyed the movie the story was fun but the lore wasn't completely correct to the D&D role play lore. otherwise it was a good enjoyable experience.
It was sooooo good from beginning to end it was interesting
Just a great fun movie, you don't need any prior knowledge of dungeons and dragons to enjoy it. it's just a great film and the cast are excellent

I really really enjoyed this movie. I'm a big dungeons and dragons nerd, and after so long of getting excited for dungeons and dragons movie content and being disappointed this was so good and so worth the wait. This movie obviously has a targeted audience but that audience will not be disappointed. There's something for fans of every class and aspect of D&D. The whole cast is so easy to love and get attached to, it's a fun story, the whole thing is just great.
Surprisingly good! Enjoyed it. Not perfect. But a great theatre experience.
Terrible. I fell asleep on it twice, eventually ended up walking out on it.

We loved it. Very fun movie. Full of action and has a lot of funny moments. My girlfriend didn’t know anything about the Dungeons and Dragons game and still really enjoyed it. The story was great. Easy to follow and entertaining all throughout. I enjoyed the character development as well. The acting was very good too. I hope they make a 2nd one. I would definitely watch this again.
It was full.of action and hilarious!
Loved this movie from beginning to end!

While formulaic as one would expect of fantasy theme, above average storytelling and comedic qualities shone bright.  The tearjerker and happy ending were very satisfying.  Action & fight scenes were also top notch.
Definitely better than I was expecting it to be. It was pretty dang good and I loved the humor.
It was definitely a good breath of fresh air for me. I really enjoyed the spectacle this movie provided. The comedy was spot on and the plot was intriguing. I’d recommend it for sure!
I think the special effects were good.  The story was a little predictable but it was great fun.
Like the sense of humor very entertaining. Was rarely bored

Really surprised by how amazing this movie was its everything you want in a fantasy adventure. Not only incredibly funny but the fighting choreography was insanely good and fun to watch! I really hope they continue the story at some point!!
Delightful story line and character development- looking forward to the sequel !
I enjoyed the dry humor. Effects with dragons was very good. It was fun in general. Dont think itd be good for kids.
Movie was funny and bad ass!!

Love the story line, lots of action, clean no sex and very little cursing. Good move to take the kids and family.
 Finally some decent entertainment

Was a great family, comedy action movie!
The CGI was not the greatest but overall I highly recommended.
   Love how they highlight that we should not ever give up not matter what, fight til the end!
   The two hours didnt feel too long
It was a good action movie
Great movie. I know nothing about Dungeons and Dragons, but thoroughly enjoyed the movie. Would absolutely see it again! The whole family loved it!
Very long but very funny. The actors all performed their roles well. I would see again. The story was very interesting and captured the jest of the dungeons and dragons mythology.
A lot of fun and some great laughs. It is very silly but in the best possible way. It's nice not to have the same old super heroes, these ones were a lot less super, but still... they were heroes ;)
Very fun and enjoyable movie, even for those like me who are not interested in Dungeons and Dragons!

Many of the characters lack proper development existing only as plot devices.
Acting is great with no weak points.
All practical sets and costumes are very good but many digital effects fall short (with painfully obvious greenscreen work).
Had this movie come out a couple years earlier I think I would have liked it much better.

This movie delivered great action, humor, and remembered  to not take itself too seriously.  I used to play D and D a lot and this was like you were on the campaign , yet didn't feel like a game but a movie.  Great job and was wonderful to see some of the classic cartoon nodded to and classic monsters come to life.  Loved it and so did my husband.
Such a fun movie. Im not a huge fantasy person, nor do I play the game, but it was just really fun!
This movie is FUN fantasy with great acting, action scenes and magical cgi. BRAVO!!!

Charming, fun, and hilarious, but has a heart and soul that keep it going and feeling important until the very end. The film has a good blend of action and comedy. Most of the major plot developments feel earned and reasonable within the world of the story. My main gripe is that, while some of the characters are fleshed out and well-developed, others (namely Doric and Forge) have little to no character development or backstory whatsoever. Overall, though, it's a lot of fun and even a bit heartwarming.

Dungeons and dragons is a masterclass on world and character building, in just one movie it manages to submerge you in an outstanding universe and interesting story. It always manages to surprise you with the plot and it's impossible to guess what's going to happened next. You really care for all the characters and it continuously  makes you laugh on the right spots. It is a really fun family movie and I would recommend it immensely.

An extremely fun, comedy filled, action-packed, great blockbuster. The movie has great pacing, all of the cast is charming, and all of the characters have reasons for doing what they do. Both CGI and practical effects are very cool. And the movie's constant D&D references and ways a DM may present the story is very clever. There are a bit of toning problems and the story is pretty straightforward but it's a good old fashion dumb fun blockbuster!

This is a romp through an alternate world filled with evil wizards, magical monsters, dragons and the cheekiest pair of rogues with the best one liners.
Worth every minute, and with chuckles that turn into laughs through the movie. Chris Pine and Michelle Rodriguez are the best buddy pair in many years.
This is a great movie adaptation, also has a lot of funny and adventure elements, but the dragons in the movie are a bit too few.
So funny and just like being a part of the actual games.
We absolutely could use more casual fantasy movies like this.
It was a funny movie and it had its moments.

This is my favorite movie in years. It's just a straight up great movie. I love Dungeons & Dragons and this is a perfect representation of what it's like to play a tabletop campaign. It doesn't take itself too seriously, but it isn't just a big joke either. It was a perfect mix of serious, funny, emotional, and heartfelt moments. I can assure you there will be both laughter and tears, and you will be doing a whole lot of smiling throughout the movie. Chris Pine, Michelle Rodriguez, Reg-Jean Page, Justice Smith, Sophia Lillis, Hugh Grant, Daisy Head, and Chloe Coleman all did a great job portraying their characters and made the movie better for it. The effects, both practical and CG, greatly enhanced the movie and there were some amazing landscapes and sets portrayed too. All in all, this is a must watch film for anyone looking to have a great time whether you're a fan of D&D or not. 

I would also highly recommend reading the two prequel novels, Druid's Call and The Road to Neverwinter, too since they go deeper into the characters' origins and motivations, which really enhanced my enjoyment and made me feel a deeper connection with each of them.
Great movie!  Funny and adventure.  Even if you know nothing about Dungeons and Dragons this is a great, fun movie.
Action packed movie! that storyline was great too.
Just plain fun with just the right amount of heart.  (And yuck...)
Kind and nice movie with good jokes.

"Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves" is a 2023 fantasy heist action comedy film. Based on the tabletop roleplaying game Dungeons & Dragons (D&D). It has no connections to the film trilogy released between 2000 and 2012. 

It follows a charming thief, Elgin (Chris Pine), a bard, and a band of unlikely adventurers Holga (Michelle Rodriguez), a barbarian; Xenx (Regé-Jean Page), a paladin; Simon (Justice Smith), a sorcerer; and Doric (Sophia Lillis) a tiefling druid, as they undertake an epic heist to retrieve a lost relic. 

Also starring Hugh Grant as Forge, a rogue and con artist. Chloe Coleman as Kira Darvis, Edgin's daughter. Daisy Head as Sofina, a Red Wizard of Thay.

Months ago, when I saw the first trailer, I thought this would be a semi-interesting movie worthy of HBO viewing. But within the last week, I had the urge to see at Imax. So I did...

It was both good and bad. It did not give the D&D vibe. But really, how could a movie entertainingly give the tabletop feel of rolling a 20-sided dice to determine success? It was passably entertaining as a fantasy/comedy. Chris Pine had the same "Guardians of the Galaxy" humor.

There were a variety of characters to relate to based on your makeup. Not surprisingly, I most connected with the paladin, but I also found the bard and druid very entertaining. 

IDK if it is worth going to the theater to see, but if you have the time and money - go for it. But you are not missing out on an epic event if you never see it. (5/10)
This was everything it needed to be. Very fun film to watch, besides the fact that it was based on 5th edition.
Honestly a really fun adventure film. I really loved the practicals and how much love was put into this film. I'd be down to watch more of these films.

Super fun!!

If you have some experience with DnD I would recommend supporting this film! It captures the vibe of a DnD session so well, well maybe not if you have a bunch of min/maxers or rule sticklers, but its a fun don't take yourself too serious film. They have side quests that may or may not contribute to stopping the BBEG, there are comedic moments, oddly heartfelt moments, straight bad ass moments. The practical effects are stunning, everyone does a great job playing their role.

Some critiques would be that it can be mcguffiny at points, where they find something that helps remedy the situation but, honestly if you frame your mind around it being a DnD campaign you can chalk it up to the DM tossing the players a bone. It might be a lot of suspension of disbelief for non those unfamiliar with DnD or have a different preconceived notion of DnD. It ultimately is a comedic heist film, just with fantasy elements.

Apart from few quirky jokes, nothing much to indulge a moviegoer. I love sci-fi fantasy genre but this movie does not deserve the 90% RT has given. Basic 2.5-3 / 5 kinda movie. Won't bore you down but won't get you excited either. 

PS 
RT ratings have become unreliable like IMDb these days .
There is nothing deep, there is nothing even particularly memorable, but what it is meant to do it does really well.
perfectly encapsulates the DnD experience in an amazing visual format really enjoyed it.
What an excellent movie, the mix of sarcasm and good story makes for an great time. There are a couple of parts where I was laughing so hard I thought it was going to pass out.
It was entertaining and light hearted.  It was the best option when compared to all the other movies listed as evil or dark.
He handles both the comedic and emotional sections in an incredible way. Excellent characters and a great imagination make Dungeons and Dragons a awesome movie.

Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is an extremely fun, light, exciting, beautiful, and full of easter eggs. Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves will please both RPG fans and those who have never heard of it, where the cast shows synergy in the comic and dramatic moments of the story. I haven't had a good laugh in a long time watching an adventure movie, with smart jokes and at the right time. Another point that cannot be forgotten is the homage to the original Dungeons & Dragons design, for those who are from the 90s had their moment of nostalgia. Finally, Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is a great movie to watch with the family, at home or at the cinema, and have fun lightly without the pressure of having to see 50 films beforehand to understand the story.

As someone that played D&D in my teens, this movie brought back a lot of fond memories of time spent with my friends adventuring. While some of the 'rules' of D&D were broken during the course of the movie, they made the story fun rather than ruining the idea of it being a movie based on a game.
Very fun movie, I laughed a lot.
Loved the characters, the action, storyline. It was a tiny bit cheesy but great fun.
A fun movie, very light hearted with many funny moments in it.
It was ok. I’m not much on that kind of humor. But the graphics were pretty good
The most plump dragon ever!
Loved it as a D&D player and DM
Nostalgic. Ended the movie craving for a round of D&D.

To be honest, when I saw there was another D&D movie coming out, I cringed. Past D&D movies have been an absolute failure. After seeing this one, it was a breath of fresh air. If you’re a fan of D&D, then you must watch this movie. What every other D&D movie did wrong in the past, this movie makes up for and goes light years beyond them. The cast was perfectly picked, the action, adventure, comedy, history and flow of the movie was awesome. I would watch this movie again and again because I’m sure I missed things.
A very good movie with action, FX and fun story. I have had the feeling to play to a RPG game in group. I will buy it when it will be available in blu ray.

Been years since a movie has come out that I went to see twice. While not sticking close to game rules as characters like the Druid and Bard never cast any spells this is still a really good and fun movie.
Really felt like a D&D campaign brought to the screen.
D&D is well written, has a great cast, its very funny and is a visually gratifying adventure. top notch costume and character designs as well.
This was such a great movie! My husband and I enjoyed every second of it. Good job.
Funny movie  good to watch with family
Excellent fantasy movie with a great story. There are some very funny moments too. Great visual effects.
Honestly Don’t know much about D&D the game but this movie was so much fun! Started of slow but picked up as it went on. Great Movie !
wow, so much better than expected. great story and effects.
Not a D&D person but the movie was ok.  Not upset I saw it but would have rather seen Air.  Had some funny parts and some cool scenes but over all it was meh.
This movie was surprisingly good. The jokes were times well and always landed. Not sure if it helped not knowing anything about the game.
Very enjoyable but I would have liked a more serious version. Tired of the incompetent character version. The special effects were really good.
It was pretty coo. I enjoyed it haha.
Slower start, but great stuff... lots of subtle stuff that gave props to DnD players since the 1970s
All in all, it's a good DnD campaign set to screen, everyone has their roles and each character brings something different to the table (shockingly).
It was extremely funny, even when it was serious, the dead guys were extremely funny and I 100% suggest
Loved this movie! Entertaining from start to finish. It was funny, action packed and I enjoyed the D&D humor subtly sprinkled throughout.
It was okay, not great. Very generic for a fantasy movie.

A bit too much a "then this happened then this happened then this happened then this happened" plot lite action sequencer for me; but not without its merits, occasional impressive action scenes, and very funny bits too. Inspiration hops from from Monty Python, Harry Potter and Maze Runner in different scenes, and from the Portal, Dauntless and Bayonetta video games in others, making the constant "and then this happened" scene hopping, varied at least. I never played D&D, so can't say how well it's honoured it's source material, but I did like the brief real to life cameos of the characters from the 80s cartoon that I used to love as a kid! Also fun to see Hugh Grant playing Boris Johnson as the villain! Plot lite, light hearted fun.
overall entertaining movie. a few slow spots did not hinder me from enjoying it
This movie was exciting from start to finish. I loved all the characters and I had tears in my eyes towards the end.
Better than expected. Funny, engaging, visually rich. Also liked the music. Not an instant classic, but a worthy popcorn entertainment.
Love Chris Pine, special effects awesome, supporting actors great

9.5/10 would and did rewatch.
funny as fk
plot made sense
Pretty funny. CGI was pretty good as well.
Loved the humor, fun interactive camera work and wonderful editing. The music was tight and the actors seemed like they were having fun.
Great movie for fans of D&D. Also great for casual viewers

There have been a few D & D movies from the past, and they were all horrible. This made up for them. You finally did it. What a fun entertaining movie with some cool monsters and D & D stuff. Keep it up

Extremely funny, but without forcing it. The jokes feel like you are in a real RPG table, and do not compromise the story. I'm glad we finally got a great adaptation of Forgotten Realms and I'm looking forward for more movies!

I know I'm in the minority here, but I thought the film was painfully boring.  Maybe it's because I love DnD, and just showing me an owlbear isn't enough.  With all the story possibilities that could have been told, all the campaigns that have been run, this was the forgettable one shot that no one will ever remember.  

I'm glad the game has become more widely accepted because of the film.  I just wish people would be honest and admit, this isn't a sleeper hit, it's just a film to put you to sleep.
Colorful, funny action packed. I enjoyed it . Four starts because it had a slow start

I might be biased because I am an avid dnd player and have been for years, but this movie was actually amazing. I genuinely loved it. The storyline was compelling with the perfect amount of comedy and the characters were skillfully developed. Surprisingly, I really enjoyed Chris Pine in this movie, he fit his character very well.

It started out a bit slow. I was arms folded and being critical, I am 60 yrs old and many decades ago I was a dungeon master with my graph paper and cup of multi-sided dice. I confess, it sucked me in. By the end, Bravo! Well done. A movie I liked better than Harry Potter for my kids. ( Yes, I have young kids, none of your business) It is actually better than I expected. Highly recommend. Enjoy.
Really fun movie, a little to long but definitely a must watch.
Awesome fun!! Go see!!! Action laughs action magic monsters and dragons = perfect escapism!
Entertaining in a good way, Funny
Great movie, my husband wanted to go so I agreed to go. And I’m pleasantly surprised by how great of a movie it was.
I rarely go to fantasy movies, but I liked this much more than I expected. Fun with the grandkids. I easily recommend.
Humorous and quirky!
Awesome show! Must see

I found the characters interesting. The action scenes were fun. I found the music played louder than the voices. It was hard to understand what was being said at times. Many scenes reminded me of other movies like - The Dark Crystal, Lord of the Rings, Peter Jackson's King Kong. The closing credits were done like Monty Python's Flying Circus. Which I think is a nice homage. Watch for a small clip at the end.  One part I found original, and very entertaining, was the waking of the dead. First time I laughed. Overall it was good, but I wouldn't watch it again.
Great cast, great characters, and great story.
Enjoyable light hearted movie that you could watch & get laughs at. No heavy swearing & no bloody killings.

A light-witted take on the D&D world, with characters that are at best level 3, and thus can barely qualify as ambassadors of the world of heroes and legends that is D&D. Everyone here is too dim and protected by plot (except the out-of-nowhere Paladin) to ever be able to survive 5 minutes in one of Gygax's dungeons.

It's a movie made by people who are obviously more fan of Marvel than they are of D&D, and thus end up with something mediocre that's stuck in the middle.

A capable and inspiring wizard, a Bard that can use magic and not just rely on others, a Druid that's not a walking plot key, and a real villain (Forge) that is not a Hollywood take on what a D&D villain is (full of sarcasm and modernisms, when he should be full of power), all those would have helped to make this movie more than just a mediocre copy of The Avengers.

Oh, and making the only relevant dragon of the movie fat is very good at making it a joke, instead of the awe-inspiring threat it should be. Guess that's the best you can do with a bunch of level-1 characters...
This is the best film of the year and of my LIFE. it's the no.1 film to see, words can't express how perfect this film was, it was the greatest movie you can see, BEST MOVIE MADE!

My wife and I had a good time watching this movie. The storyline was solid and the acting was good. The special effects were wonderful!! It was a very good movie night out with her. Plus, at Marcus there is a restaurant/bar to enjoy before your movie!!
Fun adventure, good jokes, this movie is really good.
True to the game. A very fun movie.

It tried really hard to be both funny and serious at the same time and really wasn't great at either. While not a terrible movie by any means, it had absurd elements like the dragon that just fell flat and were neither funny nor particularly thrilling. I mean if there were a dragon in the location of this one, it would be a true apex predator using all of its intellect and powers and would truly be a terrifying force to behold and not an ungainly, bumbling and idiotic caricature of what a dragon should be.
Fat dragon, great settings and special fx.  Better than expected
Good movie overall. The story line reminded me of pre 2000s fantasy movies in which the dialogue and scenes were very well paced and made you feel like you got your money's worth content-wise.
For me, this movie is absolutely wonderful. It shows very strongly how a fantasy world should be shown on the big screen. I really hope there will be more parts
It was a perfect balance of funny, serious, and the unexpected. It definitely did D&D proud.
Great entertainment! I look forward to the next installment.

The first hour really dragged on. Not much excitement and limited laughs. The second half was definitely better, but this is a movie I should have waited for it to come out on streaming and save the cash.
An action-packed fantasy, liberally sprinkled with humor. My grandson and I thoroughly enjoyed this movie.
An adventure film with dnd themes.
A fun and funny movie you dont need to be into the role playing game to enjoy it, but it has plenty of references for the more invested fan. Special effects are great.
Very good movie. Lots of action definitely recommend
You don't need to be a Dungeons and Dragons fan to enjoy this movie.  Equal parts humor, action, and heart.

This movie sucked so bad.  Hollywood took something cool and made it into lame CHEESE once again... it was like watching some lame kids show...on the T.V. no pulse drama and    ....Hugh fkn Grant...???? for real ..the character comedy and expressions, even worse than the casting of the film
Storyline was meh. Action scenes were short and not very good.  Characters weren't really developed
Surprisingly enjoyable and funny.
This movie was extremely entertaining, even for someone who doesn't play much D&D I was immersed.
So fu****ing good! I love it.
Very funny! Great story line! Wonderful Actors!
Actors were amazing needed more action the story dragged
Fun! Nothing earth shattering, but charming and adventurous, with great visuals.
The movie dragged. my husband even fell asleep.

Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is a masterpiece that has left audiences in a shock. The movie has an impressive cast, including Chris Pine, Regé-Jean Page, and  Michelle Rodriguez. Each actor delivers a standout performance that brings their character to life on the screen. The special effects are also top-notch, creating a visually stunning world that immerses viewers in the fantasy realm. Overall, Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is a must-see film for fans of fantasy and adventure. Its captivating storyline, talented cast, and stunning visuals make it one of the best movies of 2023.
Loved the adventure and fun effects! Great story very entertaining
Lots of fun, great script, wonderful choice of actors and actresses for the characters—fun incarnate.
We very much enjoyed this movie. We watched with our six year old daughter, and she wants to know when the next one comes out :)
Entertaining and enjoyable, loved the chemistry in the cast.  Fun story even if you aren't into D and D.
It was super nice very nice family movie or just for teenagers and nerds
It was good little parts were funny but the way I see it a little different the storyline keeps changing I know what's about buy my feelings where opposite
Awesome action and very funny.
More of a family adventure comedy
More of a kidish movie then I thought going into it. One funny part really stuck out for me other than that I would not watch it again.
Lot of action and good plot
It was humorous and fast paced.
It was super funny and you could see how it played out like a real campaign.
Very good action and comedy film. Not sure if your supposed to know about d an d other movies but I don’t think you need to m ow anything to see it. We loved it

its so fun! i went to see it with my grandma and was afraid she wasnt going to understand, but we both loved it!
its so emotional and fun i dont think im going to ever get tired of it.
Good enough to watch once not good enough to watch again, a lot of the animals looked pretty fake.
Fabulous and Funny!  Absolutely pleasantly surprised!  Took our son and I didn't want to leave for refill popcorn.
Loved it. What a great movie.  Lots of fun and humor.
Dungeons and dragons honor among thieves was great fun with super actors and wonderful special effects! It was a lovely afternoon out!!
Fun movie. Brief credits scene. Fun for the kids
Incredible movie. A lot of fun and great visuals. It was better than what I expected from the trailers.
Great action and cgi

Very entertaining! Very nostalgic to a guy who played the game as a kid. A couple nit picky D&D nerd things I didnt like, but thats no reason to not  recommend the movie. If you like high fantasy with thieves, dragons, and a hafling love triangle (with a world famous star playing the hafling no less!) then check out this flick!
Fun.  Funny.  Entertaining. Sweet.  Cute.
Its a very fun and exciting film. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Decent story, great cast, best comedy was in the trailer.  Was hoping for better comedy throughout, but all in all very enjoyable if not a bit slow in a couple parts.  As for D&D references, not very strong:  Names and monsters very reminiscent, but a couple of funny things missed - like when you roll pathetically for attack (comments could have been hilarious) or running into constant annoying attacks as you trek to your next destination.  Just thoughts if they duex a two.
cool movie, but was less fun because I don't know D&D very well. Some parts of the movie were a bit silly, but otherwise a fun movie
Great family moment !
Great movie, hope they make more!
Entertaining and funny
I dont do DND but it was good nonetheless just not the best Ive seen. Could have waited for it to stream but it was a nice night out.
A fun, adventure with a few funny moments…but very forgettable when you wake up this next day.
Fast-paced, with minimal slow or pointless scenes.  Packed with humor that kept you laughing the whole time.  I would go see it again.

A great fantasy action and adventure romp.
It's a crowd pleaser of a movie that hits the spot.  It's just good old fashioned unpretentious, entertainment.
If you didn't like it you're probably terminally miserable.
I took my 14 year old niece and we both loved it. I hope they make a 2nd movie or better yet a show.
It's like having a D&D evening with friends: anarchy, chaos, fun, fun, fun! I love this movie! Give us more!
An amazing experience, so fun to watch all the detail and care that went into this movie! Really hope it's a hit because I have to see a sequel to this!
Very refreshing action amazing world building with a great story and heart
It was kind of boring at first but then at the end had more action.
It beat the expectations I had for it I enjoyed the comedy elements and I liked how everyrhibg was well balanced although it  was a bit lengthy
Extremely entertaining whether or not you know anything about Dungeons and Dragons
Beautiful, funny, and an absolutely thrilling storyline. Exceeded my expectations and I must say left me with a smile leaving the theatre.

Everything I hoped for and more. The MCU is over. It's time for the DnDCU! …. Someone find a better name..

Action packed the fight choreography was on point. Super artsy in the film style. I laughed my butt off! Great storyline. Didn't feel rushed or too long at all. Fantastic film!
It was pretty true to the lore. Good cgi, writing, and choreography.

Don't worry if you've never played the game before. I grew up watching the early 80's cartoon series of this, and have always loved it. This movie blew my expectations wide open. 
Not only were the special effects amazing, but the action and jokes keep you entertained throughout the entire film. 
Every character was perfectly cast, and it had me on the edge of my seat! 
A truly wonderful film that brings the magic of cinema back to the movies! ❤️
10/10 highly recommend.
Clever, humorous, & excellent cast chemistry.

Just kidding. I don't know how good the movie is. Rotten Tomatoes says you can watch it on Apple TV. No you can't, but you can pre-order it!
Rotten Tomatoes does this intentionally. They are probably paid to do it, because a certain % of people that are fooled by this will just go ahead and pre-order it. 
Don't do it, people! If you don't fall for that trick, then it won't be lucrative for them to do it, and they will stop!

Fun for the whole family. But not very serious. Too light hearted to be taken serious-- scene where they were about to be executed they were joking like the threat was nothing. So that takes away from fear of any real harm. Still, entertaining and kosher for the whole family. My kids loved it. Last battle is best part imho.

Brought to you by the duo who wrote Spiderman Homecoming and Game Night comes Dungeons and Dragons. This was witty, and fun. With its classic storybook fantasy setting and the right blend of action-packed adventure and laughs, Dungeons and Dragons is sure to entertain! The premise, chracters and the humour kept me invested. I don't know if Michelle Rodriguez performed most or all of her fighting scenes but wow! It would be nice if her acting matched. I'm a fan, I'm not knocking her. Whenever I see her in different movies, I feel like it's the same person. But, It doesn't take away from the movie. Throughout, the visual effects and cinematography are top notch. D&D is a great popcorn movie.

I was surprised at how this movie really made me laugh. Time and time again, I was blown away by the comedy of it and its hilarious ways to make you think something was going to happen, only to surprise you with something else that was even better. 10/10 Would recommend.
I’d say this movie was pretty good. The CGI was decent and there was definitely some funny moments. This was a nice light hearted fantasy movie.

THOSE MANIACS... THEY'VE FINALLY DONE IT. THIS IS A -GOOD- D&D MOVIE! :)

All kidding aside, if you're a fan of the RPG, this is a must watch. If you don't know the game, this is still an excellent family-friendly saturday morning movie.

Congratulations to all those involved! :)
10/10 movie, the action was top tier and the comedy was on point I need a sequel.
The director follows the formula from the marvel movies. Good action mixed with good humor. If you like marvel movies you'll like this one!
Loved the effects in the movie
I am a long time player of d&d. It stayed true to the he. It had action, drama, comedy. It was well acted. Overall I really enjoyed it.

The kinda movie that knows what it is and what it needs to accomplish. The humor was appropriate for D&D and the heart was there, although it could’ve probably learned to balance the two a little better. Still, it sets up the world of the Forgotten Realms very well and I hope this turns into a franchise.

This movie was good, not great but not bad! There were extremely funny scenes, plot was okay (A little messy), and a tad too long but the fighting scenes were on point and delivered a great D&D movie. The characters were fun to follow as well, totally recommend seeing this film if you enjoyed playing the actual game itself, like humor, and enjoy the action!
The surround sound seemed extremely loud.
A little too long of a story line

Walked out after an hour. Didn't understand what was going on at all, even after the heavy expository open. I suppose D&D is mostly exposition when it's played, but cinema is about showing, not telling. Just one lad's opinion.
Totally entertaining!
Great DnD adaptation with a twist of humor!

Quite a bit of time, energy, talent, creativity, and money went into this movie. It looks amazing. But, at over 2 hours it was way too long. The movie needed a good editing to tighten the pace and make the story more understandable.
Great movie, I enjoyed every single minute.

The concept of this movie actually got me out of the house and into the theaters and I was not disappointed. I love the franchise and hope they make more movies in the dungeons and dragons world. The beauty of dnd is that they could "milk" the world and it would never get old because dnd is so flexible and malleable to make thousands of different stories. This story actually tugged at my heart strings and I was drawn in the whole time. While watching the movie I imagined what they had to roll to get the different events that occurred. More movie adaptations of dnd campaigns should be made. Its such a fun concept and I hope to see more movies made from this franchise.

This was a really fun movie to watch, Chris Pine, one of my favorite actors, does an excellent job as the lead. Overall this is a charming adventure and is worthy of a watch for sure. Many of the jokes landed and you end the movie feeling good.
Honestly, went in with very low expectations but turned out to be a great adventure movie with a perfect run time leaving you wanting more and more!!

to be fair, the cast that was assembled for this film is what drew mean to the theater, the first 10 minutes of the film that framed the backstory were the most interesting to me and could have been developed far better. Instead, the film takes a hokey bizarre turn into this absurd, slapstick,  film with such a predictable plot that I left halfway through the film. There are virtually no redeeming qualities about this movie. It was just really really bad
Great blend of Action, Comedy, Fantasy and Adventure… https://youtu.be/adFNV2peEiM
Absolute primitive nonsense with really cheesy acting.

The movie is based from the classic game and it's like uncharted concept. This movie is mighty you can't missed it in theatres you must go check it as soon as possible I can't remember how many movies I watched like this because I'm not interested like videos games movie remakes but it is very interesting and amazing
Surprise of the year outside of megan so far this year. Always looked fun and goofy in the trailers but this went way beyond that. Honestly would call it a must watch

This movie was beyond boring.  I wanted to walk out but was hoping it would get better.  Spoiler alert…. It didn’t get any better.  I love D&D that I grew up with, which had nothing to do with this story.  I also really liked the lead actors in this movie, yet it was still not any good.  I professionally trained as a writer/ producer in the Biz, so not just an opinion….                       It’s very sad you can’t Trust movie ratings anymore!
It was a great movie funny and action packed
Great movie overall.

You will not regret seeing this movie, whether you are a tabletop fan or not. This movie is a great adventure film through and through. For those that do play Dungeons and Dragons, the movie does a great job of throwing Easter Eggs into the mix which really adds value. 

The movie does great with the humor, one of my favorite scenes introducing an unsuspecting cameo. Even though humor is prevalent, it does not diminish the overall plot which is well thought out and engaging. This is a must see for Dungeons and Dragons fans, and a fantastic watch for the everyday movie goer and will not disappoint.
Really enjoyed the action. Would definitely watch again

Fun, simple entertainment.  I tend to not like fantasy movies because of all the over the top names of characters and places (which is a fantasy staple), making them and handful to keep up with.  This is a clean, straight forward story, cool effects, doesn't take itself too seriously.  And an awesome childhood Easter egg
Very good movie. Loved the cameo

Everything about the movie was incredible! The pacing was great, and it kept me engaged the entire time with seamless shifts in tone, story, and action.  All of the RPG references were clever enough not to be droll or for the sake of cheap comedy. The characters were all very likeable, and although most developments were predictable, it was a worthwhile watch. So happy to have seen it!!

It was not bad.  A little dragged out at times. The coming attractions showed all the good action parts so there was not much as a surprise or that added to the film. Story line was good and most of the acting was good.  Chris Pine was good.

I loved the game growing up.  Since then, no justice has ever been served on it.  Some great things may have been inspired by D&D, but nothing with the true title has worked.  Not in video games. Not in movies.  The cartoon was OK at first but disappoints.  This movie is more of the same.  Had such high hopes.  Fell completely flat once again.
The real dnd experience. Was going to go see it with friends and 95% of us couldn't make it at rhe last minute. It really feels like a game of dnd
Fun, entertaining, and visually stimulating! We loved this movie.
It was funny 10/10 would recommend it

Loved the movie, great to see DnD on the big screen. Would like to see a script written to highlight more of the games version of the world, a little more depth, and maybe just some better storytelling instead of formulaic Hollywood. But I love the genre
Fun adventure. And a movie for the entire Family.

I played D&D back in the 70s when it was just starting out. The team in this movie consists of a thief, a weak wizard, a Brute barbarian and a Druid. A Paladin shows up for an assist to the team achieving its goal. The storyline is predictable and while I give Kudos for some of the humor (Hugh Grant was Hugh Grant), I found the pace of the movie and the predictability of the plot to be less than I hoped for.
Lots of fun and the special effects are cool. Michelle Rodriguez is a force to be reckoned with.

Was a fun movie overall and worth a watch . But there was no need to race swap Elminster . Would have been better to make a new character to fill his spot . It was pandering and gave  a PoC a hand me down character.

This movie was a critical hit! As a 20 year D&D vet, it's great to see the source material handled so well. Great characters and an engaging story with some great laughs and plenty of heart. This movie has something for everyone.
Just a lot of fun. Sit back and enjoy!

Wonderful movie, I've seen it twice already! My only complaint is it not completely following the rules of DnD, but considering it was a movie I understood why. You don't need to play dungeons and dragons in order to watch it either. I'd recommend seeing it and can't wait for it to come out for home purchase.
Good story, true to the game.  Good all age humor.  You even feel you were seeing the reactions of DND players in some of the lines
So much fun. Enjoy the story and the ride.

By far one of the best movies I have seen recently. When I walked out of the movie theater, I wanted to go back in and buy another ticket. Very funny and emotional at times. All the characters are awesome and the fight scenes are very well choreographed.
it was fun, quipy and an all around laugh!
A good movie! Exciting and fun. If you play the game, it will be better.

Wow, Wow, Woooooowww! This is by far the best movie I have seen in a long time, with nothing, not even the tiniest detail to complain about. Thus a clear 10/10 points. The landscapes, real as well as virtual ones really stand beyond anything you have seen in Lord of the Rings or Harry Potter, etc., the settings are perfect, the fighting convincing (well, mostly, it's fantasy after all) and the story is simply nice and entertaining. And there are so many incredible details within the sets and the CGI, that one could watch it 5 or 10 times and would still surely always discover new parts in the background which somebody had to spend days to design. I, in fact, could watch this movie already tomorrow again. I am flabbergasted how a dull and absolutely boring game of 1974 (I played it once for about 30-40 minutes before I desisted) could have been transformed into such an amazing spectacle. I am sure that there won't be more than a few dozen people who won't enjoy it. Once again: 10/10!
Very entertaining for an 80s guy.
I thought it was a good movie, it had funny parts romantic parts and lots of action. I really enjoyed it.
This is a Must See for DnD players! Very fun movie and faithful to the source material (for 5e at least). That said, those who don't play can still enjoy the story. Well done
When released to own this movie will regularly be played on my devices when I need some entertainment.

What a fun ride that was genuinely entertaining.  It stuck to the AD&D style, and although the characters start fitting archetypal forms, the actors and story fill them out.  On a large scale, the story was predictable, but the humor started shaping it, and by the end, I was hoping they would all live.  
It was a romp through the canon world of AD&D, and I wanted the rogues to win.  Hugh Grant was truly being amoral.  I would recommend this to anyone that likes this corner of filmland.
I didn't even know what D&D was and I still loved it best movie of 2023 so far

The initial plot exposition at the starting flashback was little tiring, but the initial parole board was a good chuckle. I liked everything after the exes meet up again. Some decent character development, but plenty of great humor, a good redemption plot, and plenty fantasy RPG tropes from the original. And yes, I even got teary eyed (without magic).
"Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves" isn't the most grounded or clever thing in the world, but laugh-out-loud comedy and elaborate D&D references will suffice for most viewers.
Actual rating is 3.5 stars but this system doesn't let you do half stars.  Chris Pine is always fun to watch.  Overall not a bad movie.
It was fun and very entertaining.  I enjoyed the whole movie!!  Could have followed actul Dungeons and Dragons a bit more but maybe in the next one.
One of the best films of 2023. Absolutely loved this film! Becomes like a Dragon Ball Z episode in the end! Go watch it on SCREEN X.
'Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves' is a fun-filled and wholly accessible fantasy adventure that is both epic and hilarious.

I loved this movie, and my knowledge of D&D is minimal at best. My grandson and daughter both enjoyed it.
Larger than life, exciting, and funny, with plenty of adult humor thrown in. 
Everything I go to the Movies for!
Love,loss,fatherhood,compassion,greed,betrayal. All with plenty of laughs along the way this movie checks every box dynamite action with an amazing story line. Best movie I have seen all year
Thought the movie was done well
Amazing visuals, effects, cinematography, and world building. Plus a long awaited live-action cameo!
More if a made for TV movie

I know nothing about the Dungeons and Dragons game, but I absolutely loved this movie. It is such a fun movie. The characters are all so good, and there is so much great humor and emotion in this movie.
The movie had a good story.  There was humor, but it wasn't campy and the acting was good.

This is welled summed up as Fantasy Guardians of the Galaxy. An intense but ultimately silly plot pushes the movie along, but the actors really give it everything.
Entertaining throughout! 
While over my usual 100 minute attention span, I didn't look at my watch once.

This movie was a delight, to the eyes, the senses, in every way one of the year's best movies.  Every character stayed true to character - and when the movie finished, it felt complete and satisfying.  I wanted to see more of these characters even as the credits were rolling.  Huge thumbs up for any sequels!

I was very worried that this movie would ruin Dungeons and Dragons as a concept for an actual film, but I was pleasantly surprised. I feel like this movie does a good job portraying what the game is like, while also making it very entertaining to watch. I found myself laughing out loud multiple times and coming to love many characters. Great movie overall!
A delight from start to finish. Great cast. Funny. Good action. Hope they make more!

Let's be honest we don't know how to play dungeon and dragons, but you don't need that ! This movie is an awesome movie, the jokes were amazing the storyline phenomenal. You don't need to know anything about dungeon and dragons. Watch now!

From my part. the greatest movie of the year yet. Whoever played D&D, WoW etc. before, will understand everything. This movie literally shows what happens if you roll the dice, and something bad happens.
I absolutely love the whole movie, especially at the end when they gave life to the little girls surrogate mother, instead of her birth mother.
Action adventure. Decent plot and special effects. Just was hoping for something more complex either in the characters or the story line.
My whole family loved it
A lotta of fun! Great cast. Top notch visual effects.
It was ok, parts quite humerous.
This movie was quite entertaining. I can't say it was particularly compelling or worthy of repeated viewings. But, I enjoyed the time I spent watching it.
The best fantasy i ever seen. No matter you know rpg or not you will have fun. What else? Simple story:)
this movie deserves the praises it got. don't know much about D&D the game but this movie was on point.

I'd like to say that with all these terrible adaptations of AMAZING worlds (like the Witcher or the LotR) you have to watch this as one of the best movie of something we love and know... But I don't want to put this in these words. I mean, only - duh. 

Even if you don't know this world... Sure, you might not get some jokes or refferences but it's not changing the fact how amazing this movie is. Each of the characters is hold tightly in the hug of love made by all who created this, plot, world, backstories, jokes, EVERYTHING is just as I could ever beg for. I don't need perfect CGI, I need more movies like this. I am so happy that a lot of the characters had just COSTUMES instead of full rendered CGI. Suuure it wasn't hyper-realistic. But it was REAL for me. I feel that every character has their purpose, I feel that I want them all to be happy, I want to know them better. I feel like everyone can find a character that fits to them perfectly and it's not like "check list" in most of the movies right now.
Loved it! So funny! The whole family enjoyed it, and we're going back to see it again.
Wonderful movie. Great plot. Great action sequences. Lots of heart.

I'm a huge old-school D&D fan.  Having said that, this had nothing of the magic that made D&D great.  I could have made a much better movie, and I have zero movie experience.  It was almost like the writers/directors read about D&D and then made a movie.

Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves it's a movie for fans from the adventure genre who misses a good and fantastic journey with irregular heroes, captivating characters, a good touch of humor and dazzling plans that can go wrong at any time.

Phenomenal from start to finish. The casting was perfect, the story was amazing, the visuals (while whacky sometimes) were great, the references to D&D proper were unobtrusive to the rest of the movie but welcome to those who are looking for them. The ONLY issue I have with the entire movie is the primary antagonist (warlock) can sometimes have a cringe moment, but it only happens once or twice in the entire movie and the moments are quickly filtered out by the rest of the amazing film. I cannot recommend it enough for those who play D&D and those who don't.
Fulfills it's purpose: being fun and representing D&D in a good way.

This is basically if Lord of the rings & guardians of the Galaxy had a baby. Very fun movie that alternates between predictable clichés & 10/10 amazing set pieces, battles & humor. At least least 5 scenes blew me away or had me dying laughing.
Too bad it won't have a sequel
It was a medieval guardians of the galaxy basically. Team fighting a bad guy with similar comedy and actors. Nothing original about it.
Funny and entertaining. Really impressive and surprising for being a fairly new IP to the movie industry. You can tell everyone was having a fun time.
Exhilarating and wholesome ride. Makes me want to get my party back together

Very Marvel like in bringing a modern sensibility to a distinct genre, in this case the medieval fantasy space. Like Marvel, solid actors were brought in to good effect. The writing was crisp, fast paced, but focused on a story line that brings in all audiences, fantasy fans or not. Well done, and looking forward to more.
A whole lot of nothing crammed into over two painful hours of mumbling and incoherent babble.  The new movie formula is a flop and so boring you might fall asleep.
The story was fantastic, the action and humor really helped move the film along. I absolutely love how you can see the D&D spirit throughout the movie.
Loved it all! Took grandchildren and they loved it too! There was a bit of everything in this movie! Romance—family—suspense—wizardry—intrigue and a wonderful happy ending. Will watch it again.
This movie was actually so good it was super funny, the fight scenes were epic, and even after all of that it was overall a super good story, if your thinking about watching it then i think u should
Very entertaining! Great cast and great story line. Really enjoyed it!
Super fun movie, great humor. Really good pace, one character didn't get alot of character development, but everyone else had great growth and depth.
Great movie, with a great story. The characters work really well together and keep you interested.  Really hoping they make a sequel cause the world they built is amazing!
It was a fun film and it kept us engaged for its full length.

I cried laughing. A few times. Hard for movies to do that anymore. CGI lacked a bit but good storytelling and humor that actually hits completely save it. I loved it and will watch it again and again.
I was never big on DND, but Honor Among Thieves easily balances out all the tools needed for an entertaining adventure story. Fans of the campaign will easily adore this.

It was entertaining. Not absolutely amazing, but definitely not stupid.
Was funnyhad good actiongood graphics and a decent plot.
Good actors too.
Rotten and boring. Almost fell asleep twice. Kind of wanted Chris Pine’s character to die most of the movie.
It was hilarious and tons of fun. Highly recommend!
No complaints. Was a very enjoyable movie.
I love dnd but even if you don't my cousin doesn't play or know anything but he loves it and seeing it for the 3rd time soon
I loved the effects and the plot/characters were fun and the journey they toon was very enjoyable
The only thing I know of Dungeons and Dragons is the cartoon from when I was a kid . This movie wasn't that but it put the reference in 👏👏👏 Brill film .

movie felt kind of like a video game in some moments (in a good way) the comedy hit the spot just right and the visuals were nice too. I was on a screenX format and was a bit dissapointed by it. Once again, the movie is great!
Great adaptation of the DnD world to the big screen! Cannot wait to see what type of stories and campaigns they will tell next!!
Fast paced, very busy movie.  Mostly good fun, but a little sappy and predictable at parts.  Special effects were good.
Was okay, but could have been funnier. They also never played the Led Zeppelin song that was highlighted in the trailer for months.
Funny! Sort of like guardians of the galaxy, with a different Chris. The Chris here, Chris Pine is perfectly suited for this .great adventure/caper, comedy action film. See it! Take the kids.

A very safe movie that doesn't really do anything surprising or interesting.
Overall I was bored.
was better then i thought Hollywood finally did good with Dungeon and Dragons
Hilarious, exciting, & fun! I love playing d&d so catching the game content was fun for me- but there wasn’t too much to annoy/confuse people who have never played. Great acting and writing.

This film was fantastic! The story telling, pacing, acting, combat scenes, and overall cast chemistry was much better than I anticipated. This is not art, it is an entertaining movie worth every penny.

I liked that you didn't have to be familiar with the Dungeons and Dragons game to enjoy the movie. It's good for what it is, a fantasy action movie with plenty of comedy and a few sweet, poignant moments sprinkled in.
Some of the fantasy characters and creatures could have looked better.
It was a good entertaining movie.  Not over the top amazing but good.
Very entertaining and filled with references to D&D and other roleplaying games.

This movie just did its job very well and brought the spirt of the game to the mainstream. Its has the right amount of action, great chemistry between characters, fun adventures and most of all that feeling of companionship, which in my experience sums up the D&D game.
Hard to follow story line.  Less than stellar acting from most of cast.
So many easter eggs!
Hilarious and plays out like an actual dnd game
This movie is demonic
Fun, humorous, intelligent while still playing homage to the game it is based off, there is no need to have prior knowledge to the Dungeons and Dragons game to really enjoy this movie!
It had some slower moments, but overall this was a great movie.
The movies was fun, exciting, and well done. Enjoyed the cast
Very good film, I have nothing to complain about in terms of the plot or anything else, I think the work was perfect for something that had a low budget. So watch and enjoy.
I loved the action and the humor, was very entertaining, I would rent it to watch again
Good story, cast, and mix of action, drama, and humor.
Great visual effects with a funny cast! As I'm not an avid player of the game, I didn't pick up on all the jokes/story, but overall some great action, packed fun!
Some cheesy moments but overall, a good big screen experience.
Not a bad film, but not great. The word unexceptional comes to mind.

better then I thought it would be.
previews did not do justice. I would watch it again
MUST see! My favorite movie in the last few years. Funny, great story too!
awesome film hoping for a sequel!!! yes go see it!!!
Good originality and very entertaining.
Solid Film bit predictable but good for what it was offered
You don't have to play D&D to enjoy this movie, but if you do there are plenty of little extras to tickle you. Very funny, highly entertaining.
Had some good special effects but meh:
I thought the pacing of the movie felt a bit wonky. Overall the movie was enjoyable, not something I regret seeing.
Average adventure movie with predictable plot, witty one liners, and no mention of a roll of the dice. 2.5/5
It's entertaining, not bad.
Great Comedy, Really love this.
It exceeded our expectations and was true to the game yet very entertaining even if you’ve had zero exposure to the Lore.
It's a very nice movie! Fell myself in a role of D&D with my friends! It's everything good in the movie! Hope to see the next one!
Good film, Chris Pine was great as usual.  It was a bit too long. could have been a half an hour shorter.
Great characters and effects and plot.
It’s a fun fantasy movie epic with a lot of humor and heart. A must watch!!!

Ive never played D&D before and came into this movie highly skeptical that Id like it.. and left extremely surprised at how much I enjoyed it! It had a great mix/balance of epic adventure, humor and heartwarming story. Highly recommend!
Loved it!  Reminds me of the first guardians of the galaxy.  Great movie!!!!!

Dungeons and Dragons: Honor Among Thieves is good fun, a must see if you ever played campaigns in the Forgotten Realms around a table. This is the first DnD show in a long time that got the tone right. It had the feel of a player campaign without directly beating you over the head with the meta of it all. Engaging story, charismatic characters that while hitting the familiar themes don't fall too far into stereotypes. I very much enjoyed the pacing which seems intentional to capture the feel of playing a role-playing game around the table. A good mix of subversion of expectation and easter eggs for the initiated. I would be interested to hear how someone who never played would feel about it. I'll be playing to own this one when it's available to put along side my copies of "The Gamers" films. Great example of a team who clearly "get" DnD and love it, and aren't just cashing in on the IP name recognition.
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!!!! But would not recommend watching it if you don’t like lord of the rings or the hobbit because it’s similar

This was a fun film. Not the best film I've seen but definitely one of the best D&D adaptation films by far. Pacing could have been a bit better, but overall it was enjoyable. Definitely some nods to D&D fans, including a cameo cartoon fans may be familiar with.
I liked all the action and the actors did an excellent job.
Very funny movie with lots of action. I recommend
Fun move w great characters and effects. Entertaining but could have been a bit shorter.
Great movie! Very entertaining and above expectations! Great adventure!
Entertaining from start to finish. I saw this movie on my birthday weekend, which rounded out a perfect couple of days!
Crowd pleaser and plain fun.

rt_summary: A charming thief and a band of unlikely adventurers undertake an epic heist to retrieve a lost relic, but things go dangerously awry when they run afoul of the wrong people. Dungeons & Dragons: Honor Among Thieves brings the rich world and playful spirit of the legendary roleplaying game to the big screen in a hilarious and action-packed adventure.
